page.title: 01General Review of Area.
page.content: Most of our area lies within{'The {Undercliff'}a region of landslip ground that extends along the island's southern coast and which has beautiful cliff and coastal scenery,a very mild climate and a rich growth of natural vegetation.The remainder of the region lies to the north on{the chalk downs } between Whitwell and Ventnor. Ventnor is the main town and it developed from a tiny fishing village into a Victorian health resort and spa at a time when Queen Victoria lived on the island and as sea bathing became popular.The chief buildings are;The Royal Hotel,Lislecombe,Woolverton Manor,Old Park and several other Victorian villas in the village of St.Lawrence. The region now is a popular{holiday resort}and retirement area. Fishing and farming are now of minor importance.
